@loadedwino Also worth mentioning iTunes backups of your phone will capture all the data locally stored in the app.
@loadedwino Would actually love your feedback about it – how would you like expect export to work? CSV dump?
@loadedwino Good Q. We are serious when we say data belongs to you so we've made export a priority.  We're in planning stage for that now.
@loadedwino Good point. Our upcoming releases will improve this whole situation. We hope to regain your support in the future.
@loadedwino We never upload photos and we have strict policies to protect your privacy. Your data belongs to you! http://t.co/qoWsIyw84O
@loadedwino We can do better though! It's on our roadmap to improve the clarity of all the sync options, we don't want to confuse anyone.
@loadedwino Good Q! We found that the overwhelming majority of customers just expect it to work fully synced. Asking them confused them.
@loadedwino Hi Daniel, Heyday works completely offline if you turn off Sync in settings.
@seattlebasil @heyday the badge updates every time heyday creates a new memory. We will make that more clear in the next update. Sorry!
@hswolff hope that helps!
@hswolff if you turn off sync in settings, heyday works client side only. The kmly requests to server are anon geocodes for place names.
@abrahamvegh Thanks for reporting that bug! We will check it out. So sorry about it. We take privacy seriously so this is major.
@abrahamvegh you can also turn off sync in settings. In that mode heyday stores data locally. Anonymized geocode requests only.
@abrahamvegh anything we can do to earn back your support? We consider ourselves stewards of data, we store on your behalf if you'd like.
